summary: Mobile Payments SDK for Android 2.3.1
details:
### Android Mobile Payments SDK 2.3.1

* The Mobile Payments SDK now supports Android API 35. 
* To comply with data privacy laws, merchants in Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union must [grant or deny consent for analytics and performance tracking](mobile-payments-sdk/android#data-privacy-consent) by Mobile Payments SDK applications. 

**Settings Manager**
* New field- `trackingConsentState`. Returns the current consent state for the authorized Square merchant. The options are:
 * `PENDING` 
 * `GRANTED` 
 * `DENIED` 
 * `NOT_REQUIRED`

* New method - `updateTrackingConsent(granted: Boolean)`. Log whether merchants using your application have granted or denied consent for performance and analytics tracking. If this method is not used, and a payment is made in a country requiring consent, the first payment prompts the user for permission.

* This release also includes improvements to accessibility and Tap to Pay on Android.

summary: iOS Mobile Payments SDK 2.2.4
details:
### iOS Mobile Payments SDK 2.2.4

This release includes:
* Improvements to [offline payments](mobile-payments-sdk/ios/offline-payments).
* Improved [Square stand](mobile-payments-sdk/ios/square-stand) reliability.
* Additional safeguards to prevent incompatibility with future OS updates.

summary: In-App Payments SDK: Digital wallet payments in Japan
details:
## Digital wallet payments
* Sellers in Japan can now accept digital wallet payments with Apple Pay and Google Pay. Apple Pay and Google Pay are now supported in [all regions in which Square operates](payment-card-support-by-country#digital-wallet-payments).

summary: In-App Payments SDK 1.6.5 for Android: Accessibility improvements and bug fixes
details:
## Android In-App Payments SDK: 1.6.7

* The [minSdkVersion](https://developer.android.com/training/basics/supporting-devices/platforms.html#sdk-versions) is now API 28 (Android 9) or later.
* This release contains improvements to UI accessibility and bug fixes.

summary: In-App Payments SDK 1.6.5 for iOS: Updates and Bug Fixes
details:
## iOS In-App Payments SDK: 1.6.5

This release contains: 
* Improvements to form and UI accessibility
* Bug fixes

summary: Mobile Payments SDK for Android:
details:
* The Mobile Payments SDK is launching in the United Kingdom as a private alpha. Please contact developerbetas@squareup.com for information.

### Android Mobile Payments SDK 2.3.0

{% aside type="important" %}
__Deprecation notice:__ 
* `readerInfo.state` is deprecated. For a more descriptive representation of a reader's state, use the new `readerInfo.status` field. For more information, see [Reader status](mobile-payments-sdk/android/pair-manage-readers#reader-status).
* `idempotencyKey` is deprecated. To handle idempotent payment requests, use the new `paymentAttemptId` field. For more information, see [Idempotency and payment attempts](mobile-payments-sdk/android/take-payments#idempotency-and-payment-attempts).
{% /aside %}

* `readerInfo.status` - A new sealed class with more descriptive reader representation. It replaces the deprecated `state`. The possible reader statuses are:
 - `ConnectingToDevice`
 - `ConnectingToSquare`
 - `ReaderUnavailable`
 - `Faulty`
 - `Ready`
* `ReaderUnavailableReason` - A new enum with detailed error information for unavailable readers.
* `ConnectionType` - A new enum in the `ReaderInfo` class describing the connection type of the reader. The possible connection types are:
 - `USB`
 - `BLUETOOTH`
 - `AUDIO`
 - `EMBEDDED` 
* `paymentAttemptID` - A new parameter representing a payment attempt. When included in the call to `startPaymentActivity`, an idempotency key is generated by Square and regenerated if multiple requests are made for a single payment attempt (for example, in markets with Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) requirements).
* `readerManager.retryConnection()` - A new method for retrying the connection with Square servers in the event that a reader's status is `ReaderUnavailable`. 
* `getIdempotencyKey(paymentAttemptId)` - A new method to retrieve the final idempotency key used for a payment attempt. 
* `getAllIdempotencyKeys` - A new method for retrieving all payment attempt IDs from the last 24 hours and their idempotency keys from local storage.
* `currentPaymentHandle` - A PaymentHandle for interacting with the currently active payment. `null` if no payment is in progress.

summary: Mobile Payments SDK for iOS: Bug fixes and new method for accessing the payment handle
details:
### iOS Mobile Payments SDK 2.2.3
* Resolved a reader connection issue caused by a power-related update.
* Fixed a crash when using Tap to Pay on unsupported iOS versions.
* Improved error handling for `accountAlreadyLinked` errors.
* Implemented timeout logic to avoid persistent “payment in progress” errors.
* Added a new backwards compatible API method: `PaymentManager.currentPaymentHandle` exposes the current active payment handle or returns nil if no payment is in progress.

summary: Mobile Payments SDK for iOS: Support for iOS 18.4.1
details:
### iOS Mobile Payments SDK 2.2.2
* Beginning with version `2.2.0`, the minimum Xcode iOS deployment target has been raised to 16+.
* This release addresses an issue causing crashes for some devices running iOS 18.4.1. Developers should upgrade the Mobile Payments SDK to version 2.2.2 before deploying their application to devices running iOS 18.4.1.

summary: Mobile Payments SDK for iOS: Support for iOS 18.4
details:
### iOS Mobile Payments SDK 2.2.1
* Beginning with version `2.2.0`, the minimum Xcode iOS deployment target has been raised to 16+.
* This release addresses an issue causing crashes for some devices running iOS 18.4. Users of Mobile Payments SDK version 2.2.0 and below should upgrade to version 2.2.1 before updating their operating system to iOS 18.4

summary: Mobile Payments SDK for Android and iOS: processingMode is required
details:
### Android Mobile Payments SDK 2.2.0
* `processingMode` is now a required field within `paymentParameters`. `AUTO_DETECT` is the preferred mode for production payments, as this mode will select the optimal payment mode (online or offline) depending on network and Square connectivity. The Square Sandbox doesn't support offline payments, so test payments made in the Sandbox should use the `ONLINE_ONLY` `processingMode`.
* The minimum compatible version of the [Android Gradle Plugin](https://developer.android.com/build/releases/gradle-plugin) is version 8.4.2 or later.
* While offline payments are in Beta, [sellers must contact Square and opt-in](mobile-payments-sdk/android/offline-payments#seller-onboarding) to offline processing with the Mobile Payments SDK. 

### iOS Mobile Payments SDK 2.2.0
* The minimum Xcode iOS deployment target has been raised to 16+.
* `processingMode` is now a required field within `paymentParameters`. `autoDetect` is the preferred mode for production payments, as this mode will select the optimal payment mode (online or offline) depending on network and Square connectivity. The Square Sandbox doesn't support offline payments, so test payments made in the Sandbox should use the `onlineOnly` `processingMode`.
* While offline payments are in Beta, [sellers must contact Square and opt-in](mobile-payments-sdk/ios/offline-payments#seller-onboarding) to offline processing with the Mobile Payments SDK.

summary: Mobile Payments SDK for iOS and Android : Tap to Pay, Canada and Australia launch
details:
* New [Flutter plugin](mobile-payments-sdk/flutter) for the Mobile Payments SDK. 
 * The Mobile Payments SDK is now available in Canada and Australia.

### Android Mobile Payments SDK 2.1.0
* [Tap to Pay on Android](mobile-payments-sdk/android/tap-to-pay) - Sellers can use their supported Android phone to accept card payments with the Mobile Payments SDK, without requiring the use of a Square Reader. 
* Application signature requirement - Developers are required to provide Square with an [application signature](mobile-payments-sdk/android#application-signature) before taking production payments with version 2.1.0 or later.

### iOS Mobile Payments SDK 2.1.0
* [Tap to Pay on iPhone](mobile-payments-sdk/ios/tap-to-pay) - Sellers can use their supported iPhone to accept card payments with the Mobile Payments SDK, without requiring the use of a Square Reader.
* Application signature requirement - Developers are required to provide Square with an [application signature](mobile-payments-sdk/ios#application-signature) before taking production payments with version 2.1.0 or later.

{% aside type="info" %}
iOS developers using Xcode 16 might receive warnings when uploading to the App Store regarding missing [dSYMs](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/xcode/building-your-app-to-include-debugging-information#Build-your-app-with-symbol-information). This is expected because the Mobile Payments SDK doesn't include its own dSYM. These warnings can be disregarded. For more information, see [Apple Developers](https://developer.apple.com/forums/thread/761589?answerId=806733022#806733022).
{% /aside %}

summary: Mobile Payments SDK improvements
details:
### iOS Mobile Payments SDK 2.0.2
* This release contains general improvements to ensure a smoother and more reliable SDK experience.

summary: Reader SDK Deprecation and Mobile Payments SDK React Native plugin
details:
* **Mobile Payments SDK:**
 * New [React Native plugin](mobile-payments-sdk/react-native) for the Mobile Payments SDK.

* **Reader SDK:** Deprecation notice
 * The Reader SDK is now deprecated and will be retired on **December 31, 2025**. Developers must [migrate to the Mobile Payments SDK](mobile-payments-sdk/migrate) to ensure continued support and application functionality.

summary: Mobile Payments SDK for iOS and Android : General Availability in the United States
details:
### Android Mobile Payments SDK 2.0.2
* Fixed a bug that caused payment failures on devices with barcode scanners.
* Previously, devices running Android 10 or older could experience a `SQLiteException` crash when upgrading Mobile Payments SDK. This has been fixed.
* Logging and documentation improvements.

summary: In-App Payments SDK 1.6.4 for iOS: Updates and Bug Fixes
details:
## iOS In-App Payments SDK: iOS 1.6.4

- This release contains bug fixes.

summary: Mobile Payments SDK for iOS and Android : General Availability in the United States
details:
### Android Mobile Payments SDK 2.0.1
* The Mobile Payments SDK is now in General Availability in the United States.
* New [sample application](https://github.com/square/mobile-payments-sdk-android) written in Kotlin and Compose.
* `AuthorizationManager` - The `authorizedLocation` field has been renamed to `location`.
* The [Offline Payments](mobile-payments-sdk/android/offline-payments) feature is now in Beta. Sellers must continue to [opt in to offline payments](mobile-payments-sdk/android/offline-payments#seller-onboarding) to participate. 
* `OfflinePaymentQueue` - Removed the `location` field from the offline payment queue (Beta feature). Applications should use the `AuthorizationManager` `location` field instead.

### iOS Mobile Payments SDK 2.0.1
* The Mobile Payments SDK is now in General Availability in the United States.
* New [sample application](https://github.com/square/mobile-payments-sdk-ios) written in Swift and Swift UI.
* The [Offline Payments](mobile-payments-sdk/ios/offline-payments) feature is now in Beta. Sellers must continue to [opt in to offline payments](mobile-payments-sdk/ios/offline-payments#seller-onboarding) to participate. 
* `OfflinePaymentQueue` - Removed the `location` field from the offline payment queue (Beta feature). Applications should use the `AuthorizationManager`'s `location` field instead.
* The `notSupported` and `ReaderPairingError` are removed and replaced by more descriptive errors: `simulatorNotSupported` and `sandboxNotSupported`. For more information, see [Handling Errors](mobile-payments-sdk/ios/handling-errors).

summary: Reader SDK for iOS: Bug fixes
details:
### iOS Reader SDK 1.7.5
* This release fixes a bug that caused crashes for applications using AppsFlyer.

summary: Mobile Payments SDK for Android: Bug fixes
details:
### Android Mobile Payments SDK 2.0.0-beta5
* This release contains various bug fixes.

summary: Mobile Payments SDK for Android: Support for API 34
details:
### Android Mobile Payments SDK 2.0.0-beta4
* Support for targeting Android API 34. The minimum target remains 24, but starting August 31 [Google requires all Google Play apps to target API level 34](https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/11926878).

### iOS Reader SDK 1.7.4
* This release includes support for iOS 18 and adds a privacy manifest (required by Apple).

summary: Mobile Payments SDK for iOS: Support for iOS 18
details:
### iOS Mobile Payments SDK 2.0.0-beta3
* This release includes support for iOS 18, adds a privacy manifest (required by Apple) and code signatures.
* When [delaying the capture of a payment](mobile-payments-sdk/ios/take-payments#delay-the-capture-of-payments), developers can now set a `delayDuration` and `delayAction` in their `PaymentParameters`.
* Added `teamMemberId` as a new `PaymentParameters` field to associate a payment with a particular team member. To use this field, your application must request the `EMPLOYEES_READ` permission.

summary: Reader SDK for Android 1.7.7
details:
### Android Reader SDK 1.7.7
* This release contains a security fix.

summary: Reader SDK 1.7.6 for Android: Support for API 34
details:
## Android Reader SDK: 1.7.6

- Support for targeting Android API 34. The minimum target remains 24, but starting August 31 [Google requires all Google Play apps to target API level 34](https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/11926878).

summary: Mobile Payments SDK: Documentation Updates
details:
## Mobile Payments SDK: Documentation Updates
* [Mobile Payments SDK](mobile-payments-sdk) – Added a "Requirements and Limitations" section and clarified the requirements for using the Mobile Payments SDK with attended terminals or kiosks.
 * [Build on iOS](mobile-payments-sdk/ios) – Added installation instructions using Swift Package Manager.
 * [Configure the Mobile Payments SDK for Square Stand](mobile-payments-sdk/ios/square-stand) - Added a topic describing how to configure your Mobile Payments SDK iOS application to work with Square Stand.

summary: Android Mobile Payments SDK:
details:
## Android Mobile Payments SDK: 2.0.0-beta2

* Fixed a bug where restarting an application while offline could cause readers to stop working, and make them unable to take payments until online again.
* Fixed a bug with clearing new lambda-based callbacks after use.
* Fixed a bug in which `customerId` and `teamMemberId`, although correctly associated with the payment and accessible via dashboard or the Payments API, were incorrectly not associated in the returned `Payment` object.

### Documentation Updates
* [Quickstart Guide](mobile-payments-sdk/android#quickstart) – Revised the initialization example code and clarified that developers should implement a helper method to access their application ID value.

summary: NEW: Square Mobile Payments SDK
details:
### New release: Mobile Payments SDK: 2.0.0-beta1
The [Square Mobile Payments SDK](mobile-payments-sdk) has launched as the successor to the Reader SDK, enabling developers to accept in-person payments using an embedded Square payment flow in iOS and Android applications. Features include:

* Support for in-person payments with Square Reader or Square Stand.
* The ability to take payments offline (Alpha).
* Integration with the Square Payments API and Orders API.
* Sandbox support for testing with virtual readers.
* Programmatic reader management.

The Mobile Payments SDK is now available in Beta for [iOS](mobile-payments-sdk/ios) and [Android](mobile-payments-sdk/android).

summary: Reader SDK 1.7.2 for iOS: Bug Fix
details:
## iOS Reader SDK: iOS 1.7.2

- This release ends support for iOS 14. The minimum supported iOS version is now 15. 
- Addresses a potential naming conflict with a private Apple API.

summary: Android In-App Payments SDK: Android 1.6.6: Updates
details:
## Android In-App Payments SDK: Android 1.6.6
- Improved the buyer verification experience and addressed issues with buyer verification in sandbox.

summary: In-App Payments SDK 1.6.3 and Reader SDK 1.7.1 for iOS: Updates and Bug Fixes
details:
## iOS In-App Payments SDK: iOS 1.6.3

- Improved buyer verification experience and addressed issues with buyer verification sandbox.
- Fixed issue using Xcode 15 and Swift Package Manager.
- Fixed M1 support for simulators.

## iOS Reader SDK: iOS 1.7.1
{% aside type="warning" %}
Apple is currently rejecting apps submitted to the App Store which include Reader SDK 1.7.1. This is due to a private API naming collision. [Reader SDK 1.7.2](changelog/mobile-logs/2024-03-29) addresses this issue.
{% /aside %}

- China UnionPay is now UnionPay International and Reader SDK v1.7.1 has been updated with this name change.
- Fixed crashes that occur when Square stand is unplugged.
- Fixed reader connectivity issues when inactive for a period longer than 30 minutes.
- Fixed a checkout issue that displayed a white bar when using an S3 stand.

summary: In-App Payments SDK 1.6.5 for Android: Bug fixes
details:
## Android In-App Payments SDK: Android 1.6.5

Fixed an Android Gradle plug-in (AGP) issue in In-App Payments SDK version 1.6.4, which resulted in sandbox assets being omitted. Version 1.6.5 restores sandbox functionality.

summary: In-App Payments SDK 1.6.4 for Android: Updates
details:
## Android In-App Payments SDK: Android 1.6.4

Updated certificate for American Express buyer verification, without which AmEx cards cannot be verified starting October 1, 2023.

summary: In-App Payments SDK 1.6.2 for iOS: Updates and bug fixes
details:
## iOS In-App Payments SDK: iOS 1.6.2

### Updates
- Buyer verification can now be tested in Sandbox on the iOS simulator.
- Improved fraud detection for buyer verification.
- Updated resources: "China UnionPay" to "UnionPay International".
- Updated expiring certificates for AmEx buyer verification. Please update to iOS In-App Payments SDK 1.6.2 in order for AmEx customers to be eligible for buyer verification.

### Bug fixes
- Fixed buyer verification support for Sandbox environments.

summary: In-App Payments SDK 1.6.3 for Android: Updates and bug fixes
details:
## Android In-App Payments SDK: Android 1.6.3

- Minimum supported Kotlin version is now 1.8.10.
- Added new buyer actions, Charge and Store, for buyer verification.
- Updated resources: China UnionPay to UnionPay International.
- Fixed support for Sandbox for buyer verification.
- Improved fraud detection for buyer verification.
- Deprecated the Secure Remote Commerce SDK, which has led to the removal of Masterpass from the In-App Payments SDK. This deprecation occurred due to low usage numbers, and because Square’s contractual obligations with Masterpass have ended.

summary: Reader SDK 1.7.5 for Android: Support for Android API v.33 and other updates
details:
## Android Reader SDK: 1.7.5

- Support for Android API `targetSdkVersion` 33. The `minSdkVersion` is still API 24. As of August 31, 2023, Google requires all PlayStore apps to target API 33.

- China UnionPay is now UnionPay International and Reader SDK v1.7.5 has been updated with this name change.

- New dependency for Google's `android.savedstate:1.2.0` library from version 1.1.0. Kotlin apps are incompatible with the previous version of `SavedStateRegistryOwner`. Kotlin developers that depend on the previous version of the library will need to upgrade as described in the [Android Developers documentation](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/savedstate#1.2.0) on the `SavedState` library. 

- Various other improvements and bug fixes.

summary: PayPay payments support for Point of Sale API
details:
## Point of Sale API for Android 2.1 and iOS 3.5.4

This release updates the Point of Sale API versions to Android 2.1 and to iOS 3.5.4 to support PayPay QR code payments in Japan. For more information, see [Accept PayPay Payments in Japan](pos-api/qr-code-payments-paypay).

summary: In-App Payments SDK for Android 1.6.2 bug fix
details:
## In-App Payments SDK for Android 1.6.2

This release updates the SDK version to 1.6.2.

This release includes a fix to address an expired demo license issue that prevented the buyer verification flow from starting.

summary: In-App Payments SDK for iOS 1.6.1 bug fixes
details:
## In-App Payments SDK for iOS 1.6.1

This release updates the version to 1.6.1.

This release includes fixes for a localization issue for zip codes and postcodes, and issues with adding the SDK using Swift Package Manager.

summary: In-App Payments SDK for iOS 1.6.0 bug fixes
details:
## In-App Payments SDK for iOS 1.6.0

This release updates the version to 1.6.0.

Changes include:
- An important update to `SquareBuyerVerificationSDK` that mitigates the risk of declining 3-D Secure (3DS) payments.
- Various bug fixes.

If you are using `SquareBuyerVerificationSDK` earlier than version 1.6.0 for iOS, please upgrade to 1.6.0 so that the SDK can process 3DS-enabled payments. The SDK will decline 3DS-enabled payments made after March 31, 2023 if the SDK version is earlier than 1.6.0.

summary: In-App Payments SDK: Android 1.6.1 and iOS 1.5.7 bug fixes
details:
### In-App Payments SDK: Android 1.6.1 and iOS 1.5.7

You must upgrade to the latest versions of In-App Payments SDK to apply the following fixes:

- In-App Payments version 1.6.1 for Android fixes an issue with payment cancelation flows, as well as completing a verification check with NuData.
- In-App Payments version 1.5.7 for iOS fixes a React Native plugin issue with payments failing if the issuer's challenge screen contained `HREF` elements.

To upgrade to the latest version, see [Install the In-App Payments SDK](in-app-payments-sdk/installation) for Java (Android) or Swift (iOS) environments.

summary: iOS Reader SDK: iOS 1.6.9
details:
## iOS Reader SDK: iOS 1.6.9

Reader SDK v1.6.9 for iOS adds support for Xcode 14 and addresses other bug fixes.

summary: In-App Payments SDK 1.6.0 for Android: fix for processing 3DS payments
details:
### In-App Payments SDK: Android 1.6.0

!!!important
In-App Payment SDK version 1.6.0 includes an important update that mitigates the risk of declining 3-D Secure (3DS) payments. 

If you are using In-App Payment SDK versions earlier than 1.6.0 for Android, you must upgrade to 1.6.0 so that the SDK can process 3DS-enabled payments. The SDK will decline 3DS-enabled payments made after March 31, 2023 if the SDK version is earlier than 1.6.0.
!!!

To upgrade the version, update the version number in the In-App Payments SDK dependency in the module build.gradle file. For more information, see [Step 1: Add the In-App Payments SDK dependency.](in-app-payments-sdk/installation#step-1-add-the-in-app-payments-sdk-dependency) 

- In-App Payments SDK for Android 1.6.0

summary: Reader SDK for Android 1.7.4: Fixed crash when targeting API 30 and other improvements
details:
## Android Reader SDK: 1.7.4

- Fixed crash on Android 12+ (API 31+) when targeting API 30.
- Slightly decreased SDK size.
- Minimum compile SDK version is now 32.
- Fixed an issue where the "Connect a Reader" button would not display.

summary: Reader SDK for iOS 1.6.8: Fix for Connecting to the Square Stand
details:
## iOS Reader SDK: iOS 1.6.8

Reader SDK v1.6.8 for iOS includes a bug fix that addresses a connection issue with the Square Stand.

summary: Reader SDK for Android 1.7.1: Support for Android API 31
details:
## Android Reader SDK: Android 1.7.1

Reader SDK v1.7.1 now supports applications targeting Android API 31, in accordance to Google's Play Store [guidelines](https://developer.android.com/google/play/requirements/target-sdk). However, if you're adopting version 1.7.1, you will need to make a change to your application code, regardless of whether you use Google Play Store or want to target Android API 31.

If you do update the new target SDK version (which is recommended), you will need to update both the Reader SDK version and the target SDK version. For an example of how to perform this step from the Reader SDK Android quickstart application, click [here](https://github.com/square/reader-sdk-android-quickstart/pull/45/files#diff-51a0b488f963eb0be6c6599bf5df497313877cf5bdff3950807373912ac1cdc9).

If you don't update the target SDK version, you'll still need to update the Reader SDK version and also add lines to `AndroidManifest.xml` to remove the new Bluetooth permissions from the Android application. The required lines are illustrated and commented out in the Quickstart application [here](https://github.com/square/reader-sdk-android-quickstart/blob/10e488db13fc56df42fc566693ded20b137d339c/app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml#L13). 

!!!important
Square recommends upgrading the target version to API 31 by November 2022. Otherwise, you won't be able to deploy applications that don't target API 31 to Google Play Store.
!!!

summary: Reader SDK for Android and iOS 1.6.2: Bug fixes
details:
## Android Reader SDK: Android 1.6.2
- Fixes crashes occurring for certain screens on Android devices.

## iOS Reader SDK: iOS 1.6.2
- Fixes bluetooth connectivity issues with iOS 16.

summary: Reader SDK for iOS 1.6.1: Support for Afterpay
details:
Added Afterpay support for Reader SDK for iOS, version 1.6.1.

A new field `coBrand` is added to `SQRDCard`, which returns the value `SQRDCardCoBrandAfterPay` for an Afterpay transaction.

summary: Improved Reader SDK Quickstart
details:
**Reader SDK:**
 * [Reader SDK Quickstart.](reader-sdk/quickstart-guide) Revised to improve usability.

summary: Reader SDK for iOS 1.6.0: Support for Square Stand and Apple Silicon
details:
Reader SDK for iOS, version 1.6.0, now supports Square Stand S3 and Apple Silicon devices.

For more information about the stand, see [Square Stand.](https://squareup.com/us/en/hardware/stand)

summary: Android Reader SDK 1.6.1: Afterpay support and version updates
details:
Android Reader SDK, version 1.6.1, addresses the following updates:

* Added Afterpay support. The SDK returns `Afterpay` as a co-branded card associated with the tender in the `CheckoutResult` object.
* The minimum SDK version supported is 24, up from 21.
* Other general fixes and improvements.

summary: In-App Payments SDK Documentation Updates
details:
### In-App Payments SDK: Android documentation updates

The code samples in [Enable Google Pay](/in-app-payments-sdk/add-digital-wallets/google-pay), for integrating Google Pay with the SDK on an Android device, have been updated with the correct SDK version number.

summary: In-App Payments SDK updates for Flutter and React Native plugins
details:
## In-App Payments SDK: Flutter Plugin 1.7.4 and React Native Plugin 1.7.2

!!!important
In-App Payment SDK version 1.5.6 included in Flutter plugin version 1.7.4, and React Native plugin version 1.7.2, includes an important update that mitigates the risk of SCA (Strong Customer Authentication) declining on payments made with Visa after May 4, 2022.

If you are using an earlier version of Flutter or React Native plugins, you must upgrade so that the SDK can perform SCA on payments made with Visa.
!!!

- In-App Payments SDK for Flutter Plugin 1.7.4
- In-App Payments SDK for React Native Plugin 1.7.2

summary: In-App Payments SDK updates for Android and iOS
details:
## In-App Payments SDK: Android and iOS 1.5.6
!!!important
In-App Payment SDK version 1.5.6 includes an important update that mitigates the risk of SCA (Strong Customer Authentication) declining on payments made with Visa after May 4, 2022. 

If you are using In-App Payment SDK version 1.5.5 or earlier, you must upgrade to 1.5.6 so that the SDK can perform SCA on payments made with Visa.
!!!

- In-App Payments SDK for Android 1.5.6
- In-App Payments SDK for iOS 1.5.6

summary: Android Reader SDK 1.5.6 bug fixes and improvements
details:
## Reader SDK 1.5.6 - Android

Reader SDK version 1.5.6 addresses various bug fixes and improvements.

- Fix for delayed capture of card payments.
- No official support for _targeting_ Android 12 (API 31). Enabling `BLUETOOTH_CONNECT` and `BLUETOOTH_SCAN` permissions may allow running on Android 12 with an app that's targeted at an earlier version, which is supported.
- Other general fixes and improvements.

summary: iOS Reader SDK 1.5.4 bug fixes and improvements
details:
## Reader SDK 1.5.4 - iOS

Reader SDK version 1.5.4 addresses various bug fixes and improvements.

summary: In-app payments SDK for Android and iOS, and Android Reader SDK updates
details:
## In-App Payments SDK: Android and iOS 1.5.5
!!!important
In-App Payment SDK version 1.5.5 for Android and iOS includes an important update that mitigates the risk of SCA (Strong Customer Authentication) declining on payments made with American Express after December 18, 2021. 

If you are using In-App Payment SDK version 1.5.4 or earlier, you must upgrade to 1.5.5 so that the SDK can perform SCA on payments made with American Express.
!!!

- In-App Payments SDK for Android 1.5.5
- In-App Payments SDK for iOS 1.5.5

## Android Reader SDK: Android 1.5.5

Android Reader SDK version 1.5.5 has been updated with various bug fixes and improvements. The bug fix addresses an issue related to external storage permissions for Android API version 30 (Android 11) and later.

summary: Android Reader SDK new release and API changes
details:
## Android Reader SDK: Android 1.5.4

Android Reader SDK version 1.5.4 has been updated with various bug fixes and improvements. Although the update doesn't provide any new functionality, some of the improvements greatly improve Square's ability to provide support for issues that may arise. Therefore, we strongly encourage developers to adopt this version and update their applications to use it.

Due to dependency updates, version 1.5.4 also requires updating the `compileSdkVersion` build setting to 31. The `targetSdkVersion` build setting should remain at 30 or lower, depending on your application.

summary: Android Reader SDK updates and fixes
details:
## Android Reader SDK: Android 1.5.3

Android Reader SDK version 1.5.3 has been updated with various bug fixes and improvements.

!!!important
When a Square Reader fails to connect for retryable reasons while it has a network connection, it will retry every 30 seconds until it either reestablishes a connection, loses network connection, the application de-authorizes, or the reconnection attempt fails for a non-retryable reason.
!!!

summary: In-app payments SDK updated for SCA regulations in Europe
details:
## In-App Payments SDK: Android and iOS 1.5.4
!!!important
In-App Payment SDK version 1.5.4 for Android and iOS includes an important update that mitigates the risk of SCA (Strong Customer Authentication) declining on payments made after October 31, 2021. 

If you are using In-App Payment SDK version 1.5.2 or earlier, you must upgrade to 1.5.4 so that the SDK can perform SCA on payments.
!!!

- In-App Payments SDK for Android 1.5.4
- In-App Payments SDK for iOS 1.5.4

summary: Reader SDK 1.5.3
details:
## Reader SDK 1.5.3

!!!important
This release resolves an issue with Reader SDK 1.5.2 that prevents a new checkout request from starting under certain scenarios.
!!!

The following error: 
```json
{
 "code":"USAGE_ERROR",
 "debugCode":"checkout_already_presented",
 "debugMessage":"Square Reader SDK cannot present a checkout controller while another checkout controller is already presented."
}
```
prevented the host device from completing a payment until the device was restarted.

summary: Reader SDK 1.5.2 - iOS
details:
## Reader SDK 1.5.2 - iOS
!!!important
 * Fix to iOS 15 Bluetooth connections. 
!!!

summary: Reader SDK 1.5.1 - Android
details:
## SDK Changes

* Upgrade to Kotlin 1.5
* Various fixes addressing native crashes
* Fix for conflicting versions of Kotlin Coroutines libraries
* Various bug fixes and performance improvements

## Breaking changes

* If your app is still using Kotlin 1.3 or 1.4 you must upgrade to 1.5 to use Reader SDK 1.5.1. In general, the Kotlin plugin takes care of the migration, but Square suggests that you follow these guidelines for migration:
 * [Migrating from 1.3 to 1.4](https://kotlinlang.org/docs/whatsnew14.html#migrating-to-kotlin-1-4-0)
 * [Migrating from 1.4 to 1.5](https://kotlinlang.org/docs/whatsnew15.html#migrating-to-kotlin-1-5-0)

## Upgrade to Reader SDK 1.5.1

To use Reader SDK 1.5.1 you must add a workaround for a packaging issue the Square Reader SDK development team discovered during testing. This is a temporary fix. The issue will be resolved in the next Reader SDK release.

Add following inside the `android{}` block of your application `build.gradle` file:

```gradle copy_code
packagingOptions {
 exclude("META-INF/*.kotlin_module")
}
```

Refer to the Square [Quickstart App](https://github.com/square/reader-sdk-android-quickstart/blob/master/app/build.gradle#L15) on GitHub for an example of the correct configuration.

After adding the snippet, set the version of Reader SDK to 1.5.1

```kotlin copy_code
def readerSdkVersion = "1.5.1"
// SQUARE_READER_SDK_APPLICATION_ID is defined in ./gradle.properties
implementation "com.squareup.sdk.reader:reader-sdk-$SQUARE_READER_SDK_APPLICATION_ID:$readerSdkVersion"
runtimeOnly "com.squareup.sdk.reader:reader-sdk-internals:$readerSdkVersion"
```

summary: Reader SDK support
details:
## Reader SDK - iOS 1.4.9
* Various bug fixes and performance improvement.

 {% aside type="important" %}
 This update corrects issues with iOS 14.6. If your application reports a **Reinstallation Required - Please reinstall Point of Sale** message or encounters errors such as:

 * `DEBUG CODE: authorization_no_network
 * `DEBUG MESSAGE: Reader SDK could not complete the authorize request because there was no network connection.` Then you must update your the Reader SDK to 1.4.9
 {% /aside %}

## In-App Payments SDK - Android and iOS 1.5.1
* Various bug fixes and performance improvement.

summary: Reader SDK
details:
## Reader SDK 

### Android
**1.4.2** fixes a compilation error introduced in **1.4.1** when Reader SDK was used with any of the following libraries:
- LeakCanary
- AndroidX View Binding
- AndroidX Lifecycle Runtime KTX
- Protocol Buffers

If you are currently on version **1.4.1**, you should update to **1.4.2**. If you were on version **1.3.x**, you should skip **1.4.1**.

summary: In-App Payments SDK 1.3.0, Reader SDK 1.3.4: Minor bug fixes and improvements.
details:
## New release: Reader SDK 

* Reader SDK iOS version: 1.3.4


### Details 


#### iOS

* Performance improvements
* Resolves a condition that can result in a crash on application launch on iOS 13 devices.


## New release: In-App Payments SDK 

* In-App Payments SDK Android, iOS version: 1.3.0


### Details 
In-App Payments SDK for Android and iOS added support for Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) with a new method to start a buyer verification flow and get a verification token for use in completing payments. 

#### Android

* New class: [BuyerAction](https://developer.{{SQUARE_DOMAIN}}/docs/api/in-app-payment/android//sqip/BuyerAction.html) 
* New interface: [BuyerVerificationDetails](https://developer.{{SQUARE_DOMAIN}}/docs/api/in-app-payment/android//sqip/BuyerVerifiedDetails.html)

#### iOS

* New SDK: [SQIPBuyerVerificationSDK](https://developer.{{SQUARE_DOMAIN}}/docs/api/in-app-payment/ios/Classes/SQIPBuyerVerificationSDK.html)

summary: Reader SDK 1.3.3: Minor bug fixes and improvements for Android and iOS.
details:
## New release: Reader SDK 

* Reader SDK iOS version: 1.3.3
* Reader SDK Android version: 1.3.3

### Details 


#### iOS


* Now requires Xcode 10.2+
* For Xcode 11+: Add the permission `NSBluetoothAlwaysUsageDescription` to your info.plist
* If your application target is pure Objective-C and contains no Swift code, you must include the standard Swift libraries with your application. To do this:

 1. Open the Build Settings tab for your application target.
 2. In the top right search field, search for 'embed swift'.
 3. Change the value of **Always Embed Swift Standard Libraries** to **Yes**.

summary: Reader SDK now supports delayed the capture for payments.
details:
## New release: Reader SDK

* Reader SDK Android version: `1.3.0`
* Reader SDK iOS version: `1.3.0`

## Details

### Delay Capture of Payments

By default, Reader SDK will immediately capture all card payments in a transaction, but the SDK also supports delayed capture of card payments.

For example, when a customer makes an in-store purchase from a merchant, the merchant may want to authorize funds at the time of purchase, and capture funds when the item ships from the warehouse.

The `SQRDCheckoutController` (iOS) and `CheckoutManager` (Android) can be configured to delay capture of all card payments in a transaction.

* See the Reader SDK recipe for [Delay Capture of Payments](/reader-sdk/cookbook/delay-capture-of-payment) for more information about configuring the checkout flow to delay capture of card payments.
* See the [Capture a Transaction](/reader-sdk/cookbook/capture-a-transaction) cookbook for instructions to capture a delayed transaction using the Transactions API.

### Improvements

* Minor bug fixes and performance improvements.

summary: React Native plugin for In-App Payments SDK now available!
details:
## New release: In-App Payments SDK

* Android version: `1.1.0`
* iOS version: `1.1.0`

## Details

### React Native plugin release

A React Native plugin for In-App Payments SDK is now available as an open source
project on GitHub.

See the [React Native plugin](/in-app-payments-sdk/react-native) page for more information.


### Remove postal code requirements for supported regions

The In-App Payments SDK for Android, iOS, Flutter, and React Native now lets you
remove the postal code requirement for regions **outside** the United States,
Canada, and the United Kingdom.

See the [Remove Postal Code Requirement](/in-app-payments-sdk/cookbook/disable-postal-code) recipe for more information.

summary: Release of Reader SDK 1.1 with card-on-file support.
details:
## New release: Reader SDK

* Android version: `1.1.3`
* iOS version: `1.1.1`

## Details

### Store customer card

Use the new `CustomerCardManager` (Android) or `StoreCustomerCardController`
(iOS) objects to store a customer card on file. Customers must provide a valid
email address and billing zip code. And the card must be linked to an existing
Square customer profile to save a card on file.

* See the [Customers API Overview](/customers-api/what-it-does) for more information about working with customer profiles.
* See the [Save Cards on File](/reader-sdk/cookbook/save-cards-on-file) recipe in the Reader SDK cookbook for more information about saving customer cards on file.

### New `Card` properties

The `Card` object now includes the following properties:

* expirationMonth
* expirationYear
* id(Android) or cardID(iOS)
* cardholderName()

The new properties are only set for Card instances supplied in the result of the
store card flow. In all other contexts, the fields will be `null` (e.g,. in
`TenderCardDetails` after a checkout).

### Always skip signature

Square now allows sellers to skip collecting signatures on all card transactions.
Previously, the option was only available for transactions under $25.
Set the new `collectSignature` checkout parameter to indicates whether signature
collection is required during checkout.

The `collectSignature` parameter replaces `alwaysRequireSignature`, which has
been deprecated and will be ignored by the SDK.

### Bug fixes

* Removed SocketRocket Framework from iOS SDK to avoid dependency conflicts.
* Various small bug and crash fixes.

summary: Bug fix for Reader SDK on Android.
details:
## New release: Reader SDK (Android)

* Android version: `1.0.4`

## Details

* Fixed an issue that caused crashes when initializing the SDK on x86 devices.

summary: The Square Reader SDK for Android and iOS is now available!
details:
## New release: Reader SDK

* Reader SDK Android version: `1.0.3`
* Reader SDK iOS version: `1.0.1`

## Details

The Square Reader SDK for Android and iOS is now available!

Reader SDK lets developers embed the Square checkout flow and accept in-person payments in custom apps using Square Readers. You can try Reader SDK right away by following the [Reader Quick Start](/reader-sdk/quick-start/start). When you are ready to dig deeper, learn more about [how Reader SDK works](/reader-sdk/how-it-works), or start building custom integrations for ([Android](/reader-sdk/build-on-android) and [iOS](/reader-sdk/build-on-ios)).

summary: Version 1.3 of the Point of Sale API is available for iOS.
details:
## New release: Point of Sale API (iOS)

* iOS version: `1.3`

## Details

Point of Sale API v1.3 includes improvements to API parameter naming and is available in the [Square Point of Sale](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/square-register-point-sale/id335393788?mt=8) app version 4.59 and later.

The optional `merchant_id` API request parameter is now `location_id`. When used, the identifier for the business location that the Square Point of Sale application is logged in to must match the value of this parameter.

See the [SquarePointOfSaleSDK-iOS GitHub repository](https://github.com/square/SquarePointOfSaleSDK-iOS) for the easiest solution to add Point of Sale API to your iOS app.

summary: Register API for iOS and Android is now called Point of Sale API.
details:
## Product rebranding: Register API is now Point of Sale API

* Android version: `2.0`
* iOS version: `3.0`

## Details

Register API for iOS and Android is now called Point of Sale API.

Changes as part of this name change include the following:
* A new [SquarePointOfSaleSDK-iOS](https://github.com/square/SquarePointOfSaleSDK-iOS) repository.
* A new [point-of-sale-android-sdk](https://github.com/square/point-of-sale-android-sdk) repository.
* Updated [Android Point of Sale API](/pos-api/build-on-android) version to v2.0.
* New [Maven](https://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Ca%3A%22point-of-sale-sdk%22), [CocoaPods](https://cocoapods.org/pods/SquarePointOfSaleSDK), and [Carthage](https://github.com/Carthage/Carthage) projects.

For more information and upgrade instructions, please view our [blog post](https://medium.com/square-corner-blog/squares-register-api-is-now-point-of-sale-api-a9956032c32a) describing the changes.

summary: Version 1.2 of the Register API is now available on iOS.
details:
## New release: Register API (iOS)

* iOS version: `1.2`

## Details

Version 1.2 of the Register API is now available on iOS as of [Square Register](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/square-register-point-sale/id335393788?mt=8) version 4.53.

Version 1.2 includes:

* Support for linking customers to transactions using the new `CUSTOMER_ID` request parameter.
* A new `CARD_ON_FILE` tender type to allow charging a previously-stored card instrument. Learn more about [how to use Card on File with Square](http://{{SQUARE_DOMAIN}}/help/article/5770).

For more information:

* See [Register API Overview](/pos-api/what-it-does) for an overview of how the Register API works.
* See [Using the Register API for iOS](/pos-api/build-on-ios) to learn how to add Register API functionality to your iOS app.
* See the [SquarePointOfSaleSDK-iOS](https://github.com/square/SquarePointOfSaleSDK-iOS) repository for the easiest solution to add Register API to your iOS app.

summary: The Square POS Web API is now available for Android.
details:
## New release: Square POS Web API (Android)

## Details

* The Square Web API is now available for Android. With this feature, developers can now launch the Square Register Android app from a website to process in-person payments with Square hardware.
* See [Using the Web API for Android](/pos-api/build-mobile-web) to learn how Web API for Android works.
* See [Register API Overview](/pos-api/what-it-does) for an overview of how the Register API works.
* See [Using the Register API for Android](/pos-api/build-on-android) to learn how to add Register API functionality to your Android app.

summary: Version 1.1 of the Register API is now available on iOS
details:
## New release: Register API (iOS)

* iOS version: `1.1`

## Details

Version 1.1 of the Register API is now available on iOS as of [Square Register](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/square-register-point-sale/id335393788?mt=8) version 4.50.

Version 1.1 includes:

* Support for [split tender transactions](https://{{SQUARE_DOMAIN}}/help/article/5097).
* A new `CASH` tender type to support cash transactions.
* A new `OTHER` tender type to support other tender transactions.
* A new `SQUARE_GIFT_CARD` tender type to support Square Prepaid Gift Card transactions.

For more information:

* See [Register API Overview](/pos-api/what-it-does) for an overview of how the Register API works.
* See [Using the Register API for iOS](/pos-api/build-on-ios) to learn how to add Register API functionality to your iOS app.
* See the [SquarePointOfSaleSDK-iOS repository](https://github.com/square/SquarePointOfSaleSDK-iOS) for the easiest solution to add Register API to your iOS app.

summary: New open-source Sample App for Register API
details:
## New release: Open-source Sample App

## Details

A new open-source sample application is now available for Register API for
Android. The sample app is a point-of-sale application for a bike shop that uses
Register API for Android to process in-person payments.

* The new application can be found in [the Github repo](https://github.com/square/point-of-sale-android-sdk).
* See [Register API Overview](/pos-api/what-it-does) for an overview of how the Register API works.
* See [Using the Register API for Android](/pos-api/build-on-android) to learn how to add Register API functionality to your Android app.

summary: Version 1.1 of the Register API is now available on Android.
details:
## New release: Register API (Android)

* Android version: `1.1`

## Details

Version 1.1 of the Register API is now available on Android as of [Square Register](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.squareup) version 4.48.

Version 1.1 includes:

* Support for split tender transactions: transactions completed using multiple tender instruments.
* Support for Square Prepaid Gift Card transactions, as part of the CARD tender type.
* A new `CARD_ON_FILE` tender type to allow charging a previously-stored card instrument.
* Support for linking customers to transactions.

For more information:

* See the [GitHub CHANGELOG](https://github.com/square/point-of-sale-android-sdk/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#version-11) for Version 1.1.
* See [Register API Overview](/pos-api/what-it-does) for an overview of how the Register API works.
* See [Using the Register API for Android](/pos-api/build-on-android) to learn how to add Register API functionality to your Android app.
* See [this Github repo](https://github.com/square/point-of-sale-android-sdk) for a sample Android application that uses the Register API.

summary: Square Register API is now available for Android
details:
## New release: Square Register API (Android)

* Android version: `1.0`

## Details

The Square Register API is now available for Android. Like the iOS version, it lets your app open the Square Register app to process in-person payments with Square hardware.

* See [Register API Overview](/pos-api/what-it-does) for an overview of how the Register API works.
* See [Using the Register API for Android](/pos-api/build-on-android) to learn how to add Register API functionality to your Android app.
* See [this Github repo](https://github.com/square/point-of-sale-android-sdk) for a sample Android application that uses the Register API.
